whenToUse: Hover on elements with secondary background

brandcolor-neutralhover.usage: Hover state for neutral buttons and outline buttons (NOT bg-brandcolor-fill)

brandcolor-textweak.usage: Secondary text, secondary hierarchy after main text

brandcolor-strokeweak.usage: ALWAYS use for: Card borders, dividers, and all other light elements
whenToUse: Secondary button borders (ALL secondary buttons use this border color - exception to button border rule)
brandcolor-strokeweak.importantNote: ALWAYS use strokeweak for card borders and dividers. Secondary buttons are an exception and also use strokeweak, but all other button borders use strokestrong.

brandcolor-strokemild.usage: ALWAYS use for: Table row borders when hovered
whenToUse: Table row borders when row is hovered (hover:border-brandcolor-strokemild)

focusState.logic: On focus, transparent border changes to primary color (#008B31).

activeState.logic: On press/active: transparent border changes to primary color (#008B31), and inner shadow appears (inset 3px 3px 10px 0px rgba(0, 26, 49, 0.33)).

criticalRules: ALL buttons MUST have rounded-md (6px corner radius) - NO EXCEPTIONS
ONLY primary and secondary buttons use border-transparent in default state (to prevent layout shift when border appears on focus/active)
Primary-outline button uses CENTERED border (border-[1.5px]) - border is half inside, half outside
Secondary-outline button uses INSET border (box-shadow) - border is completely inside the button
Neutral button uses CENTERED border (border-[1.5px]) like primary-outline
Never use rounded-lg, rounded-xl, or any other border radius for buttons - ALWAYS use rounded-md
Never use border, border-2, or any other border width for buttons - ALWAYS use border-[1.5px] or shadow utilities for inset borders
Transparent border is ONLY for primary and secondary buttons - outline buttons already have visible borders

input.description: Input fields with proper borders - MUST override Flowbite and browser defaults
input.logic: Strong stroke border by default, changes to text-strong color on focus. No extra border/ring on focus. Text color is always text-strong. CRITICAL: Must use focus:ring-0 to prevent Flowbite's default ring styles. Must use focus:outline-none to prevent browser default outline.
criticalRules: ALWAYS include focus:ring-0 to override Flowbite's default focus ring
ALWAYS include focus:outline-none to override browser default outline
NEVER allow Flowbite or browser default focus styles
Focus border MUST be brandcolor-textstrong (#001A31), NEVER brandcolor-secondary or any other color
No box-shadow on focus - use focus:ring-0
If default styles still appear, add !important in component SCSS file

Layout backgrounds: Use bg-brandcolor-fill
Secondary button hover: ALWAYS use bg-brandcolor-secondaryhover (#183885) for secondary buttons with secondary background
Neutral/outline button hover: ALWAYS use bg-brandcolor-neutralhover (#EFEFEF), NEVER use bg-brandcolor-fill
Primary button hover: ALWAYS use bg-brandcolor-primaryhover (#016323)
TABLE RULES - CRITICAL:
Table borders: ALWAYS use border-brandcolor-strokeweak for table border and row borders
Table header text: ALWAYS use text-brandcolor-textweak
Table header icons: ALWAYS use text-brandcolor-textweak
Table body text: Can be MIXED - use text-brandcolor-textstrong for regular text, text-brandcolor-secondary for clickable text/links/buttons
Selected table rows: ALWAYS use bg-brandcolor-secondary
Tables with more than 5 rows: MUST implement expandable row with bg-brandcolor-fill and 'Show All' button
Expand button: MUST use text-brandcolor-secondary class
Table structure: MUST use proper HTML table tags (<table>, <thead>, <tbody>, <tr>, <th>, <td>)

importantNotes.primaryButtonHover: When bg is brandcolor-primary, hover MUST be bg-brandcolor-primaryhover (#016323)
importantNotes.secondaryButtonHover: When button has secondary background, hover MUST be bg-brandcolor-secondaryhover (#183885)
importantNotes.neutralButtonHover: When button is neutral or outline style, hover MUST be bg-brandcolor-neutralhover (#EFEFEF), NOT bg-brandcolor-fill
importantNotes.secondaryButtonBorder: ALL secondary buttons (both types) MUST use border-brandcolor-strokeweak (#C5C5C5), NEVER border-brandcolor-secondary. This is an EXCEPTION to the button border rule.
importantNotes.secondaryButtonTypes: Two types of secondary buttons: (1) text-brandcolor-secondary with brandcolor-strokeweak border, (2) text-brandcolor-textstrong with brandcolor-strokeweak border

borderUsageRules.strokestrong: ALWAYS use for: Sidebar borders, input field borders, button borders (except secondary buttons)
borderUsageRules.strokeweak: ALWAYS use for: Card borders, dividers, table border, default table row borders, and all other light elements. Also used for secondary button borders (exception).
borderUsageRules.strokemild: ALWAYS use for: Table row borders when hovered (hover:border-brandcolor-strokemild)
borderUsageRules.secondaryBorder: ALWAYS use for: Selected table row borders (border-brandcolor-secondary) - ONLY border changes, NO background color

tableRules.structure: MUST use proper HTML table structure: <table>, <thead>, <tbody>, <tr>, <th>, <td>
tableRules.borders: Table border and default row borders MUST use border-brandcolor-strokeweak. Hovered rows use hover:border-brandcolor-strokemild. Selected rows use border-brandcolor-secondary (ONLY border changes, NO background color)
tableRules.selectedRow: Selected rows ONLY change border to border-brandcolor-secondary. NO background color change. Only border color changes on selection.
tableRules.headerText: Table header text MUST use text-brandcolor-textweak
tableRules.headerIcons: Table header MUST include Material Icons 'unfold_more' icon next to each column label, using material-symbols-outlined text-brandcolor-textweak with style="font-size: 20px;"
tableRules.materialIconsStylesheet: MUST include Material Icons stylesheet: <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Material+Symbols+Outlined:opsz,wght,FILL,GRAD@20..48,100..700,0..1,-50..200&icon_names=unfold_more" />
tableRules.bodyText: Table body text can be MIXED: text-brandcolor-textstrong for regular text, text-brandcolor-secondary for clickable text/links/buttons
tableRules.clickableElements: Clickable text, links, and buttons in table cells MUST use text-brandcolor-secondary
tableRules.expandableRows: Tables with more than 5 rows MUST show first 5 rows, then an expandable row with bg-brandcolor-fill containing a 'Show All (X) Items' button using text-brandcolor-secondary
tableRules.expandButton: Expand button MUST use text-brandcolor-secondary class and format: 'Show All (X) Items' where X is total count

beforeCreatingComponent: Check: Are there any hex codes (#008B31, etc.)? REMOVE them, use utility classes
Check: Are there any inline styles? REMOVE them, use utility classes
Check: Are there hardcoded Tailwind colors (bg-blue-700, text-gray-900)? REPLACE with theme classes
Verify: All colors come from tailwind.config.js theme colors
Verify: All color usage follows theme-guide.json rules

validationChecklist.hexCodes: NO hex codes anywhere in component
validationChecklist.inlineStyles: NO inline style attributes for colors
validationChecklist.hardcodedColors: NO hardcoded Tailwind color classes (bg-blue-*, text-gray-*, etc.)
validationChecklist.themeClassesOnly: YES - Only theme utility classes (bg-brandcolor-*, text-brandcolor-*, border-brandcolor-*)
validationChecklist.standardUtilities: YES - Standard Tailwind utilities (px-*, py-*, rounded-*, flex, grid) are allowed
